00001 #ifndef UA_ASYNC_H_
00002 #define UA_ASYNC_H_
00003 
00004 #include "ua_jobs.h"
00005 
00006 /*
00007  * For concurrent processing on multicore systems, open62541 dispatches jobs (=events) to
00008  * independent worker processes.
00009  * 
00010  * There are four types of job execution:
00011  *
00012  * 1. Normal jobs
00013  *
00014  * 2. Repeated jobs with a repetition interval (dispatched to worker threads)
00015  *
00016  * 3. Eventloop jobs are executed (once) from the event loop and not in the worker threads.
00017  * This is used e.g. to trigger adding and removing repeated jobs without blocking the
00018  * mainloop.
00019  *
00020  * 4. Delayed jobs are executed once in a worker threadm but only when all jobs that were
00021  * dispatched earlier have been executed. This is achieved by a counter in the worker threads.
00022  * If the counter has changed, then the previously dispatched jobs have finished. A use case
00023  * is to eventually free obsolete data when it is guaranteed that no concurrent threads can
00024  * access it any longer.
00025  *
00026  * - Mark the data as obsolete (with an atomic operation)
00027  * - Remove existing pointers to the data (e.g. from a linked list), so it cannot be accessed
00028  *   from jobs that are dispatched later
00029  * - Add a delayed job that frees the memory when all currently running jobs have completed
00030  */
00031 
00037 typedef struct UA_RepeatedJobs {
00038     LIST_ENTRY(UA_RepeatedJobs) lp; 
00039     UA_DateTime nextTime; 
00040     UA_UInt32 interval; 
00041     size_t jobsSize; 
00042     UA_Job *jobs; 
00043     UA_Guid *jobIds; 
00044 } UA_RepeatedJobs;
00045 
00046 #ifdef UA_MULTITHREADING
00047 
00053 typedef struct UA_DelayedJobs {
00054     LIST_ENTRY(UA_DelayedJobs) lp; 
00055     size_t jobsCount; 
00056     UA_Job jobs[UA_DELAYEDJOBSSIZE]; 
00057     UA_Boolean ready; 
00058     UA_UInt32 workerCounters[]; 
00059 } UA_DelayedJobs;
00060 #endif

00063     void *getJobsHandle; 
00064     UA_UInt16 (getJobs*)(void *handle, UA_Job **jobs, UA_UInt16 timeout); 
00065     void *processJobsHandle; 
00066     void (processJobs*)(void *handle, UA_Job *jobs, size_t jobsSize); 
00067     LIST_HEAD(UA_RepeatedJobsList, UA_RepeatedJobs) repeatedJobs;
00068 #ifdef UA_MULTITHREADING
00069     LIST_HEAD(UA_DelayedJobsList, UA_DelayedJobs) delayedJobs;
00070     struct cds_wfcq_head dispatchQueue_head; 
00071     pthread_cond_t dispatchQueue_condition; 
00072     size_t workersSize; 
00073     pthread_t *workers; 
00074     UA_UInt32 **workerCounters; 
00075     struct cds_lfs_stack eventLoopJobs; 
00076     struct cds_wfcq_tail dispatchQueue_tail; 
00077 #endif
00078 } UA_DispatchLoop;
